page.title: 15Farming in Glenisla. contd.
page.content: In 1985, 312 calves were born, 246 of which will be sold. Two out of the six farms are involved in showing their animals. There are quite a few local shows for this purpose. All six farms are of stone-built construction, the oldest dating back five hundred years and the most recent forty five years. Each is a traditionally built farm with courtyards and a variety of sheds for keeping animals, implements and storage of grain, hay and silage. Most of the farms have a good selection of implements for their own use although three of the farms hire a combine harvester, the cost of buying one being too expensive for the amount of arable land available.
